SEARCH
Package test

Class TestInvalidTransaction

java.lang.Object
test.Test
test.TestInvalidTransaction
public class TestInvalidTransaction extends Test
This class tests the blockchain network's ability to correctly identify and reject invalid transactions. It ensures that invalid transactions are not added to the transaction pool across multiple nodes.

The class sets up a small network of nodes and attempts to send what is defined as an invalid transaction to each node. It checks if each node correctly rejects the transaction by not adding it to their respective transaction pool and providing the appropriate response.

  • Constructor Details

    • TestInvalidTransaction

      public TestInvalidTransaction()
      Constructs a new TestInvalidTransaction instance. Initializes miner nodes and their respective network ports.

  • Method Details

    • perform

      public void perform() throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Executes the test for handling invalid transactions. Duplication of transactions is treated as invalid, and the test verifies that nodes reject such transactions. The method encapsulates the testing logic to verify if invalid transactions are rejected by all nodes in the network.
      Specified by:
      perform in class Test
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an I/O error during communication with nodes.
      InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted during its execution.

    • testInvalidTransactionNotAddedToPool

      private void testInvalidTransactionNotAddedToPool()
      Tests each node to ensure that an invalid transaction is not added to the transaction pool. The method communicates with each node in the network, sending a predefined invalid transaction and expecting a specific rejection response.
